SEARCH

Class Keccak

java.lang.Object
Keccak
public class Keccak extends Object
Implementation of Keccak[512] as defined in FIPS Publication 202 Section 3. Heavily inspired by and translated into Java from Markku-Juhani Saarinen's C Implementation.
Version:
1.1
Author:
JJ Coldiron (ecoldi@uw.edu), Markku-Juhani Saarinen, Paulo Barreto

      public Keccak()
      Constructor to initialize instance fields for Keccak object.

  • Method Details

    • round

      public void round()
      Performs 24 rounds of the Keccak permutation on the state array.

    • init

      public void init()
      Initializes instance fields to initial values for SHA3/SHAKE256

    • cSHAKE256_init

      public void cSHAKE256_init(byte[] in)
      Initializes Keccak object for cSHAKE256.
      Parameters:
      in - SHAKE256 prefix. bytepad(encode(n) || encode(s), 136)

    • absorb

      public void absorb(byte[] data, int len)
      Absorbs data into the Keccak[512] sponge and performs permutation when byterate is reached.
      Parameters:
      data - Data to be absorbed into the Keccak[512] sponge.
      len - Length of the data to be absorbed.

    • xof

      public void xof()
      XORs correct suffix into Keccak state. Adapted from Prof. Paulo Barreto's KMACXOF256 lecture slides.

    • squeeze

      public void squeeze(byte[] out, int len)
      Squeezes the specified number of bytes from the Keccak[512] sponge into the provided array.
      Parameters:
      out - The byte array data is copied to.
      len - The number of bytes to squeeze from the sponge.
